trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Bonus.ly | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Bonus.ly | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Bonus.ly with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Bonus.ly with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Bonus.ly
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Bonus.ly

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Bonus.ly.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Bonus.ly.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A test tenant in Bonus.ly
trans-unit.target: A test tenant in Bonus.ly

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Bonus.ly
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Bonus.ly

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Bonus.ly
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Bonus.ly

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Bonus.ly.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Bonus.ly.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Bonus.ly, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Bonus.ly, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Bonus.ly.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Bonus.ly.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Bonus.ly, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Bonus.ly, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Bonusly</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Bonusly</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Bonus.ly with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Bonus.ly with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Bonus.ly requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Bonus.ly requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Bonus.ly application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Bonus.ly application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Bonus.ly page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Bonus.ly page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Bonus.ly Tenant URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\.Bonus.ly*", and then click Next:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Bonus.ly Tenant URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\.Bonus.ly*", and then click Next:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly page, click download Certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Bonusly.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly page, click download Certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Bonusly.cer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different browser window, log in to your Bonus.ly tenant.
trans-unit.target: In a different browser window, log in to your Bonus.ly tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings, and then select Integrations and apps.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings, and then select Integrations and apps.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Bonusly</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Bonusly</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Single Sign-On, select SAML.
trans-unit.target: Under Single Sign-On, select SAML.

trans-unit.source: On the SAML dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Bonusly</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Bonusly</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP SSO target URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP SSO target URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly dialog page, copy the Issuer ID value, and then paste it into the IdP Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly dialog page, copy the Issuer ID value, and then paste it into the IdP Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bonus.ly dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Cert Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Cert Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Click save.
trans-unit.target: Click save.

trans-unit.source: On the Microsoft Azure AD portal, select the configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Microsoft Azure AD portal, select the configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Bonus.ly, they must be provisioned into Bonus.ly.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Bonus.ly, they must be provisioned into Bonus.ly.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Bonus.ly, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Bonus.ly, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In a web browser window, log into your Bonus.ly tenant.
trans-unit.target: In a web browser window, log into your Bonus.ly tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings
trans-unit.target: Click Settings

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Users and bonuses tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Users and bonuses tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users and bonuses</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users and bonuses</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Manage Users.
trans-unit.target: Click Manage Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Add User dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add User dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the “Email, First name, Last name” of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the “Email, First name, Last name” of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The AAD account holder will receive an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The AAD account holder will receive an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Bonus.ly user account creation tools or APIs provided by Bonus.ly to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Bonus.ly user account creation tools or APIs provided by Bonus.ly to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Bonus.ly, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Bonus.ly, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Bonus.ly application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Bonus.ly application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
